SEARCH:
Package com.example.labyrinthapp

Klasse PlayerController

java.lang.Object
com.example.labyrinthapp.PlayerController
public class PlayerController extends Object
The PlayerController (Singleton) class handles the movement and control of the player in the labyrinth game.

  • Verschachtelte Klassen - Übersicht

    Enumeration for representing different movement directions.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • PlayerController

      public PlayerController()
      Constructs a PlayerController instance and sets the player's starting position.

  • Methodendetails

    • getInstance

      public static PlayerController getInstance()
      Returns the instance of the PlayerController.
      Gibt zurück:
      The PlayerController instance.

    • setLabyrinthView

      public void setLabyrinthView(LabyrinthView labyrinthView)
      Sets the LabyrinthView variable so the PlayerController can communicate and send updates depending on where the player moves to.
      Parameter:
      labyrinthView - The LabyrinthView to which the PlayerController should send player position updates.

    • setLabyrinth

      public void setLabyrinth(int[][] labyrinth)
      Sets the current labyrinth for the PlayerController.
      Parameter:
      labyrinth - The labyrinth as a 2D integer array.

    • resetLevel

      public void resetLevel()
      Resets the level back to 1.

    • getLevel

      public int getLevel()
      Gets the current level.
      Gibt zurück:
      The current level.

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer(float x, float y)
      Moves the player based on the provided gyroscope rotation values. Updates the LabyrinthView if player position changed. Tells GameScreenFragment to generate a new labyrinth when the player reaches the finish and updates the level.
      Parameter:
      x - The rotation value in the x-axis.
      y - The rotation value in the y-axis.

    • determineDirection

      private void determineDirection(boolean up, boolean down, boolean left, boolean right)
      Determines the most likely wanted direction change, even if the flags suggest 2 different directions.
      Parameter:
      up - When true, an UP direction was detected.
      down - When true, a DOWN direction was detected.
      left - When true, a LEFT direction was detected.
      right - When true, a RIGHT direction was detected.

    • resetDirection

      public void resetDirection()
      Resets the direction to NONE.
